channel.title: How do i fix runserver?
channel.description: when i click runserver it comes up with.... 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. what do i do people plzz

item.title: How do i fix runserver?
item.dc:creator: @r8edhardknock03 r8edhardknock03
item.description:
@r8edhardknock03 wrote:

how do i set my Variables?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 10, 2009, 12:19:16 am[/size][hr]???[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 10, 2009, 12:21:57 am[/size][hr]what do i type in for path Variable!!!

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix runserver?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“r8edhardknock03, post:7, topic:261396”]ok i downloaded jdk and jre and it still says
‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.when i runserver[/quote]

It means you don’t have your System Variables set.

So instead of setting the variable just replace

c:\documents and settings\hp_administrator\desktop\ducsetup.exe

with wherever you installed your JDK. EX:

[code]c:\documents and settings\hp_administrator\desktop\java.exe[code]
for your compile file use

c:\documents and settings\hp_administrator\desktop\javac.exe[code][/code][/code][/code]

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix runserver?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“r8edhardknock03, post:5, topic:261396”]jdk and it said
c:\docments and settings\hp_administrator\desktop\ducsetup.exe is not a valid win32 application?
what do i do[/quote]
Well seeing as you are trying to compile your stuff with your No-ip setup :eek:

You need to set that path to wherever your Javac.exe file is located at. Or set your system Variable.

Read full topic

JDK - Java Development Kit
JRE - Java Run time Environment

item.title: How do i fix runserver?
item.dc:creator: @Patrick1 Patrick_
item.description:
@Patrick1 wrote:

Honestly, if you cannot fix this you don’t deserve a server at all, but meh. Make sure your computer has Java (-.-). Then, make sure your run-server is reading the Server (class) otherwise it won’t read anything and won’t execute the run() in Server.

Read full topic
